revised_title: Characterization of Nucleotide-Peptide Anhydrides in Yeast
tldr: The authors discovered nucleotide-peptide anhydrides in yeast, which are compounds that play a role in protein and nucleic acid synthesis. They isolated and characterized one of these compounds, Arginylalanylarginylalanyl-5'-uridylate, and discussed its potential significance in relation to protein and nucleic acid biosynthesis.
